name: Shrimp Salad With Butter Lettuce and Pumpernickel Bread
description: Known as Skagen salad in Swedish, this light shrimp salad makes a great open-faced sandwich.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring five quarts of water to a boil. Add shrimp and lemon quarters. Boil until just cooked through, about 3 minutes. Drain, cool, devein and peel shrimp. Cut shrimp into 1/2 inch pieces.
In a large bowl, whisk together mayo, mustard, and lemon juice. Whisk in chives and dill. Add shrimp and gently toss to coat. Add salt and pepper to taste.
To Serve: Top each of four plates with a piece of piece of pumpernickel and a leaf of butter lettuce. Divide shrimp equally among butter lettuce leaves.
